Package model

Class GameState

java.lang.Object
model.GameState
public class GameState
extends java.lang.Object
The GameState class is an aggregate of all classes that comprise the "state" of the application. It includes the WordChecker, an array list of Players, the GameBoard, and the various game settings.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GameState​(GameBoard gb)
    The GameState constructor initializes the GameState with the specified GameBoard, a new ScrabbleTrie(), a new array list of Players, a new WordChecker, and a new TileBag.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addAIPlayer()
    This method adds the AI Player for single player mode to the game state.
    void addPlayer​(java.lang.String s, int points)
    The addPlayer() method adds the specified player to the GameState.
    void drawTiles​(Tile[] tileRack)
    Draws random tiles from the tile bag, and places these tiles in the GUI gameboard's tile rack as well as the current Player's tile rack to replace the tiles that they placed on the board during the current turn.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameState

      public GameState​(GameBoard gb) throws java.io.IOException
      The GameState constructor initializes the GameState with the specified GameBoard, a new ScrabbleTrie(), a new array list of Players, a new WordChecker, and a new TileBag.
      Parameters:
      gb - The GameBoard object that the GameState is associated with.
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - If the constructor cannot initialize the ScrabbleTrie with words from "CollinsScrabbleWords2019.txt", "Scrabble_EASY.txt", or "Scrabble_HARD.txt".

  • Method Details

    • isCurrentTurnValid

      public boolean isCurrentTurnValid()
      This is the getter method for the currentTurnValid field; it should be called after finalize() has been called for the current turn.
      Returns:
      The boolean value true is the current turn is valid; false if not.

    • getTilesLeft

      public int getTilesLeft()

    • addPlayer

      public void addPlayer​(java.lang.String s, int points)
      The addPlayer() method adds the specified player to the GameState.
      Parameters:
      s - The name of the player to be added.
      points - The number of points the player starts out with.

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      The nextTurn() method sets the current player to the next player in the array list of Players. It should be called after finalize() and drawTiles().

    • scoreWords

      public int scoreWords​(java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement>> wrds)
      This method scores the words placed on the board during the current turn.
      Parameters:
      wrds - An ArrayList of ArrayLists of TilePlacements containing the words placed on the board during the current turn.

    • getCurrentPlayer

      public Player getCurrentPlayer()
      Gets the player whose turn it is.
      Returns:
      The Player object representing the player whose turn it is.

    • getCurrentWords

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement>> getCurrentWords()
      The getCurrentWords() method returns the ArrayList of ArrayLists of TilePlacement objects representing all words placed on the board during the current turn. This method shouled be called after finalize() has been called for the current turn.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList<ArrayList<TilePlacement>> representing the words placed on the board during the current turn. This container is empty is no valid words were placed on the board during the current turn.

    • finalize

      public void finalize​(java.util.ArrayList<TilePlacement> tilesPlaced, Tile[] tileRack)
      The finalize() method should be called after the current player is done placing tiles on the game board. It validates the tiles placed (represented by the tilesPlaced parameter) on the GUI game board during the current turn. If the tiles were placed in a valid arrangement on the board and form one or more valid words, the finalize() method scores those words and adds the points to the current player's score.
      Parameters:
      tilesPlaced - The tiles placed on the board, as an ArrayList of TilePlacements.
      tileRack - The tile rack from the GUI, which the player removed tiles from during their turn. The tile rack is an array of Tile objects, with null elements representing tiles that have been removed and placed on the game board.

    • drawTiles

      public void drawTiles​(Tile[] tileRack)
      Draws random tiles from the tile bag, and places these tiles in the GUI gameboard's tile rack as well as the current Player's tile rack to replace the tiles that they placed on the board during the current turn.
      Parameters:
      tileRack - The array representing the tile rack in the GUI, which the player removed tiles from during their turn.

    • getTileRack

      public Tile[] getTileRack()
      The getter method for the tile rack of the current player.
      Returns:
      An array of Tile objects representing the tile rack of the current player.

    • isCurrentTurnTile

      public boolean isCurrentTurnTile​(int r, int c)
      The isCurrentTurnTile() method checks whether the tile at the given position in the internal game board was placed during the current turn.
      Parameters:
      r - The row of the tile to check.
      c - The column of the tile to check.
      Returns:
      The boolean value true if the tile in the specified row and column was placed during the current turn; false otherwise.

    • getAllPlayers

      public java.util.ArrayList<Player> getAllPlayers()
      Getter method for the collection of all players in the current game.
      Returns:
      An ArrayList of Player objects representing all players participating in the current game.

    • setTutorialTooltipsEnabled

      public void setTutorialTooltipsEnabled​(boolean enabled)
      Enables or disables tutorial tooltips in the game board GUI.
      Parameters:
      enabled - A boolean. If true, tutorial tooltips will be enabled. If false, tutorial tooltips will be disabled.

    • isTutorialTooltipsOn

      public boolean isTutorialTooltipsOn()
      Query whether tutorial tooltips are enabled or disabled for the GUI game board.
      Returns:
      Boolean true if tutorial tooltips are enabled; false if tooltips are disabled.

    • setDifficulty

      public void setDifficulty​(Difficulty d)
      Modify the difficulty setting.
      Parameters:
      d - The new difficulty setting.

    • getDifficulty

      public Difficulty getDifficulty()
      Query the current difficulty setting.
      Returns:
      The current difficulty setting as a Difficulty constant.

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard()
      This method prints the contents of the GameBoard object associated with the GameState to console.

    • getNode

      public Node getNode​(int i, int j)
      This method returns the Node object in the GameBoard at the given position.
      Parameters:
      i - The row to retrieve the node from.
      j - The column to retrieve the node from.
      Returns:
      The Node object at row i and column j on the GameBoard.

    • getTilePlacedAt

      public Tile getTilePlacedAt​(int i, int j)
      This method returns the Tile object in the GameBoard at the given position.
      Parameters:
      i - The row to retrieve the Tile from.
      j - The column to retrieve the Tile from.
      Returns:
      The Tile object at row i and column j on the GameBoard.

    • addAIPlayer

      public void addAIPlayer()
      This method adds the AI Player for single player mode to the game state.
